messages.message: Sometimes the model returns the result as a sentence instead of just the number. Doesn’t seem consistent though.
cc @Kathy Wu @Wilson @Nikolaos Kofinas if you’re seeing this in the extraction benchmarks
can you try the same with gpt-4?
In build mode, you can’t change the model
+1 on nikolaos, gpt-4 is usually more consistent (at least from our benchmarks)
With Uber receipts, it returns just the value
To have GPT 3.5 respond with the value and not a complete sentence often you need to prefix your request with “return only”, otherwise GPT responds with a full sentence.

Yeah you need more prompt eng -- what Seth mentioned will usually work.

GPT4 is really slow & expensive, not a good candidate for build mode
this is true but my experience with 3.5 is that is not reliable and we need to have robust post processing to capture the cases that returns other output from what we want
+1 on post-processing, we are finding that gpt4 works better for scoring our benchmarks (in terms of output consistency)
@Wilson @Nikolaos Kofinas can you share the benchmarking results?

the results that wilson shared with me are:
```
        "precision": 0.2534435261707989,
        "recall": 0.46878980891719746,```
@Wilson can you confirm this?

also here IMO recall is more important than precsion since we dont have a complete set of all the possible labels (which is also difficult to construct) and thus we will have a lot of false positives that may be true positives.
